html:
7.23.19  6:19 pm   after quite some time of not knowing what to draw, an idea finally popped into my head last night!!!! I'm working on the drawing right now yayyyy!!!!!!!!
I've decided to try my best to make the drawing look different from my past drawings. It just NEEDS to be different, I mean, I haven't done anything in weeks! The problem that I'm currently facing is the idea that the drawing won't be worth the wait.. My audience is waiting for me to post something good, but what if the drawing doesn't end up meeting their expectations? What if the drawing ends up looking the same as my past ones despite my efforts to make it look different and unique?
Do you ever worry about this kind of stuff?

      If so, how do you cope with these negative thoughts and worries?

      Do you simply ignore the thoughts and just hope for the best? Or do you do something else?
7.23.19  5:26 pm   Have you ever just been Mad Online(tm)?

7.23.19  5:23 pm   when you were writing notebook stuff back in 2005 (or earlier), were you thinking they would be published or shown to anyone else?  

      if not, when did you decide to publish them?

7.23.19  4:55 pm   I feel so alone. Not in the sense that I don't have any friends, or nobody to talk to... but we're all humans. WHERE ARE THE ALIENS??? Shouldn't there be some by now?? Just... where is everybody? Where are they? I'm so lost and confused I wanna build a rocket ship and go exploring
7.23.19  4:20 pm   follow your heart or your mind?

7.23.19  2:11 pm   I just discovered "The Narrative", it is a magic narration by myself of my own story. It happens real time as the story unfolds, mostly out loud (not quietly inside my head), and it is extremely powerful. If it is turned off, the story defaults along, but if it's turned on, I'm in control of the story.

Is this what you refer to when you say you gotta talk things out?
7.23.19  12:40 pm   is the reason for your hiatus due to triangle boy the movie

7.23.19  8:18 am   Here's a question. In "Mount St. Helens Is About to Blow Up", you sing "all my friends, family and animals probably gonna run away". By this, do you mean "all of my friends, all of my family and all of my animals are going to run away"? Or is it instead "all of my friends and family are going to run away, in addition to animals that may not necessarily belong to me"? Thank you.

7.23.19  1:07 am   do people conceptualize time via numbers?

      do we require labels such as months and years and seconds to be able to define and understand the concept of time?

      what is time if you eliminate outside stimuli from which to gauge it?

      is it possible for us to understand time with no clocks, no sun moving through the sky, no seasons?

      this shit really starts to make no sense when you consider relativity...like how do you explain the concept of time moving faster for someone in a spaceship to your dog, which has no real idea of some grand unifying force tying different actions and memories together?

      sorry i doubt you are particularly interested in this.

      i will refrain from submitting more questions of the sort for at least another two weeks or so

7.22.19  4:45 am   how to enjoy smalltalk when I most likely dont have a lot in common with the person talking and/or not a slightest hint of what might be interesting to both of us. When you kind of feel (or maybe its just me) like you can't really open up about what you enjoy thinking/talking about for fear of being judged. How to care less about the impression I give people when my me-ness can sometimes be offputting if I do open up myself to people?
7.22.19  4:19 am   last mistake you made?
7.22.19  3:36 am   what's a synonym for bohemian rhapsody?

7.22.19  3:17 am   Have you ever liked one genre of music so much, but then suddenly discover a completely different genre that soon you aren't able to get enough of, and while you still haven't forgetten about genre 1, genre 2 is so different that you worry that transitioning back to genre 1 will be tough? I guess it's relevant to add that genre 1 and genre 2 are genres so different, that one might find it difficult to have them co-exist in a single playlist, due to the concept that these genres elicit such different moods and imaginations from oneself. But I guess, the same might not be true to you,Bill, and being able to listen to Autumn Love right after Emerald Princess is as easy as forgetting your toast in the microwave.
